185945865.review: Psychonauts is one of the most fun platformers I've ever played. It's not just a copy of other platformers but its brimming with it's own personality. I loved the story, The summer camp setting is great and every character have their own quirks and are fun in their own way (you should go talk to everyone after every level to not miss their interactions). Level design is fantastic, every level is unique and has it's own formula to get through and i enjoyed most of them especially Waterloo world in which you are playing a game of risk and lunfishopolis where you are basically godzilla and if you are the type that tends to complete everything this game is filled with collectibles. It's a game from a time when games tended to be more creative and I think it's a must play if you want a fun time.

185892685.review: Probably the most fun I've had with a game that infuriated me. The combination of floaty controls and precise platforming during certain sections made me want to end it all right there on the spot, and I'm pretty sure I missed 30-40% of the story on accident. With that being said, the story I have seen and the absolute control the game has on nearly every aspect of itself to make every character and location have a distinct identity and keep the gameplay feeling fresh sets up an undeniable charm that kept me going through the parts that absolutely pissed me off. I never would have thought a game I played because "Hehe, funny milkman guy" would be this amazing.

185883019.review: i absolutely love this game but still haven't beat it because of the meat circus. have to say the waterloo is my fav tho

185851095.review:
Ho avuto occasione di avere il gioco gratuitamente anni fa, ma devo dire che solo di recente ho avuto occasione di provarlo davvero... e diamine cosa mi sono perso.
Un gioco dalla personalità decisamente unica, una trama e i suoi personaggi scritti con un umorismo e un pizzico di satira pungente che gli danno un'anima che di recente ho avuto poche occasioni di vedere, forse persino viste come controverse al giorno d'oggi, in alcuni casi, e tuttavia rimanendo ancora una storia molto matura e profonda che contribuisce a consolidarlo come una perla, secondo me.
Ammetto di non essere abituato ai platform, ne ho giocati pochissimi in vita mia, e forse una piccola critica che posso fare al gioco è che alcune delle sezioni sono davvero... strane, sia per colpa della telecamera (un classico), che per alcune cose che secondo me potevano essere fatte meglio, tipo le sezioni platform in cui ci sono i trapezi con il personaggio che non sempre salta bene (e specie nel livello finale in cui è stato uno stress totale nell'usarli), e altre cose, come il livello della Levitazione in cui è stato particolarmente stressante su alcuni punti, almeno per me.
D'altro canto, di sicuro ciò non ha scemato la mia voglia di continuare... anzi, le parti negative vengono comunque inabissate da un gameplay divertente tutto sommato e una storia originale, che mi fa tranquillamente venir voglia di rigiocarlo e finire tutto!
Insomma, lo consiglio vivamente sia per gli appassionati di platform (e tutto sommato anche chi è nuovo può facilmente abituarvisi), sia a chi vuole un'avventura che mescola profondità di tematiche e umorismo smorzante in uno, che lo rendono armonioso e bello da giocare!

185809296.review:
This was quite a delightful change of pass compared to other games in my library. The art style, character design, and over all level design felt very unique without fear of changing it up to go along with the games concepts. I personally am a fan of games that have collectibles to obtain and keep track of my progress. Collecting everything is not necessary for completion, but it can be beneficial for leveling up your psi rank to make the game easier.

This game did however come with some downsides for this port of the game. I frequently had struggles with collisions in parts of the maps and some unstable controls. I had to put some work in to fully complete this game in spite of it's difficulties in its design, but I am writing this after my completion of everything I found the game had to offer. Withholding spoilers, I did feel the ending still lacked something regarding closure of the defeat of one of the villains. It's not the shiniest jewel, but it is still very pretty to look at and play with.

If you are looking for a nice well rounded experience and enjoy platformer/collectathon games then I cannot recommend it enough for a try. It is a very low commitment game that you could bust out in a short amount of time and still feel satisfied. With that, I shall see you on the mental battlefield fellow Psychonauts!

185539137.review:
One of the best 3D platformers ever made. Psychonauts excels at unique level design with each and every character, from Milla's disco party to Lungfishopolis's Godzilla reference to the Milkman's conspiracy. The story is held up by the ensemble of great characters and interactions, which you can easily miss if you don't explore and dialogue with everyone as your progress through the game. The art style holds up really well, and the controls still work well on a newer xbox controller. 

There are some wonky camera angles as with other games in this era, and the lock-on mechanic can get finicky at times. Figments are also difficult to spot, but there are several guides on finding all of them. This is one of the few games I've 100%ed multiple times.

Some bugs get in the way of the enjoyment, like a boss where on a latter phase the camera glitched out to the point where I literally could not see my character on the screen. I had to start the boss over in order to fix it and it happened twice more. Similar bugs occur throughout the game. Still, this is one of those titles I feel every platformer fan should play through at least once. I only wish it had better Steam Deck support.

185402903.review:
A platformer with a lot of unique aspects, but the result varies wildly between creative and cool, and frustrating and annoying. Plays okay on Linux - controller compatibility issues meant I had to rebind my controls every time I launched the game.

The visuals are super colorful and there is a ton of care put into making each mental world stand out, but a lot of it, characters in particular, is just plain grotesque - other people might be into it, but it's not for me. Similarly, the voice acting ranges from phenomenal (Boyd, G-Men, most of the adult voices) to so bad that I would rather mute the game than hear them speak (Sheegor, young Oleander, some of the other children). Getting to see inside their heads really lets you get to know the characters and sympathize with them, some information given explicitly, but even more implied by the state of their mental world. Each mental world has its own style, rules, and gameplay gimmick; most are good, some are outstanding (Milkman Conspiracy, for example), but the Asylum and Meat Circus SUCK, and as the climax of the game, this happens at the worst possible time. The mental worlds are clearly the focus, but I don't think the overarching story does a great job of tying them all together satisfactorily. Platforming works well enough, if a bit imprecise once levitation gets involved. Combat is okay, mostly just backpedal and shoot for fodder, and trial and error with psychic powers to figure out what each boss is vulnerable to. Not all powers are created equal, and they don't interact with each other much, but each has its uses, at least. No real issues with the soundtrack, but no real standouts, either.

Psychonauts is uneven, but there's a lot of interesting stuff on display here, and it's at least worth a play, even if I didn't enjoy it enough to go back for 100%.

185386810.review: I can't believe this game came out 20 years ago, an old gem that still holds up just fine to this day thanks to the cartoon stylized visuals. Mechanic wise and story are also great. The only thing I can really complain about was near the end where I felt like one of the puzzles became a bit tedious but considering everything prior of that. I just had a blast with this game.

185379612.review: Very unice platformer, even though the platforming is a bit of a slog at times. Loved these crazy locals and insane characters. Really a special game that needs more appreciation. I am the Milkman my milk is delicous!/10. I hope a sequel fixes the issues...

185324731.review:
First off, if you've watched a lot of late 90's and early 2000's cartoons then the voice cast of this game will be a real treat for you. I think this is a solid port of a game that I think most people would describe as a cult classic. It's got a familiar build to most early 2000's platformers, but I think that it adds some neat things in how to use the powers your given. I think the one thing that really struck me was how creative and interesting some of the level designs were for the time this game was made. There were some neat ideas executed here that felt a little ahead of their time and probably inspired some games that came after it. 

There were some parts of this game that I really struggled with though, one of them being the platforming. The controls are so lose and sometimes glitchy that it made progressing through the game way more difficult than what it feels like the developers intended. It also tends to do a poor job of explaining aspects of the game, like how the game never tells you how to access your inventory for the first time. There are also a fair amount of scenes that you can miss just because you do something in the wrong order or you just don't know to be looking for. I gave it a pass on most of these things because I recognize that it's a port of an old game and a lot has changed since this game came out, but i did come close to feeling like it might not be worth it to keep playing to the end at times. 

Overall I think that it's a cool game and it's worth checking out if you either like games from this era or, like me, you've heard a lot about it over the years and want to play it for yourself. It's kind of like a time capsule of a game that gave me a lot of nostalgia for the type of games I remember playing as a kid in the early 2000s. If you're looking for a tighter gameplay experience though, it may be better to check out the sequel as your intro to the franchise.

185318995.review: Psychonauts is a pretty fun game! The story, world and gameplay are all very enjoyable. It suffers a bit because of when it was made like some moments being a bit offensive and poorly handled by todays standards and the graphics being.... 2005 but I don't think those bring the game down enough to not recommend it. It's pretty cheap and if you find it on sale then you should pick it up.

185304643.review:
Years ago when I was a kid, shortly after the PS3 had just launched in Europe, I stumbled upon PS2 copies of this game at a shop. A little bit before that, not long after I had gotten my PS2, I had stumbled upon the game on an online shop and was intrigued, but I wasn't a big fan of the art style, and a screenshot of the mega censor absolutely disgusted me. I still looked at the game box and flipped it over to look at the back, but put the copy back to where it had been and went away to look at something else.

If you had told me back then that nearly two decades later this game would become one of my favourite video games of all time and dethrone the PS1 Spyro games for my favourite 3D platformers, I honestly don't know if I'd have believed you, but I still can't help but wonder how differently I'd have turned out had I decided to go through and pick up that quirky looking PS2 game that day despite the things I'd found off-putting about it at the time. The game then didn't cross my mind again until 2011 when an artist I followed on deviantART posted fan art of Raz picking up Lili with telekinesis, and I then kept hearing through the years since just how good the game was, and then its sequel came out and I heard that it was also amazing. I finally picked the game up on sale in 2022, but didn't play it until just recently.

And now I keep asking myself:

[h3]Why didn't I play this sooner?[/h3]

This game is an absolute delight. I decided to play this game on a whim when I had a craving for a 6th gen platformer or something similar. It absolutely gave me what I wanted, but it also gave me so much more.

Not only is Psychonauts a fun platformer that kept me hooked from the beginning to the end, constantly introducing new and fun psychic powers, it's also filled to the brim with details, love, and passion, and hilarious jokes and character interactions. There is so much thought put into everything. What may seem to be a hilarious throwaway joke later turns out to be foreshadowing. And while the art style turned me away from the game all these years ago, I've come to love and embrace it as an adult.
I love how much weight the collectibles hold and you don't just collect them for the sake of collecting them like in so many other collectathons, but instead one type unlocks lore, and all collectibles will contribute to your rank, which in turn enhances your psychic abilities. The levels aren't just fun to play through but they're also really creative, I was always excited to see what was next. Even Gloria's theater, with its slower pacing and sometimes frustrating puzzle solving, was a delight to play through. Also, I can't talk about how much I love this game and why without bringing up Raz himself. What an amazing little menace, he's become one of my favourite video game protags of all time.

With all of that said, this game isn't perfect, but there's very little in it that detracts from the overall enjoyment for me. Psychonauts is a 6th gen game down to its controls, they felt a little janky and unrefined at first, but since I played 6th gen platformers as a kid (and replayed a few of them last year) I got used to them fairly quickly, but if you've not played many 6th gen platformers and didn't grow up with them you may have a more difficult time adapting to them. The writing is also dated in some aspects, with its depiction of some mental issues being particularly cartoonish (though it's also important to stress this is a mid 2000s game and our understanding of mental health has improved significantly since). 
Then there's the infamous final level in which the difficulty spikes up to the extreme. Also, some of the figments can be really difficult to find, and the game has a point of no return and some missable collectibles which can make 100%ing it painful. (I wanted to 100% the game on my first playthrough but decided I'd leave it for a future playthrough.)

However, despite all of this, I still absolutely adored the game. It's very clearly a labour of love and I love it so much. And while the writing may be dated in some aspects since it's a mid 2000s game, it still approaches mental issues with as much respect and nuance as it possibly can. 

If you wanna know just how much I love this game and how hooked I was on it I played the final level and beat the final boss while dealing with a particularly nasty headache. 

Headsup but this version of the game is slightly janky. While the game never crashed for me (played on W10) and had no problem with my Xinput controller (8Bitdo Ultimate 2C wired) there are points where you have to use the mouse to navigate through menus which can feel cumbersome. The biggest issues I had with the game were frame stutters and occasional audio glitches.

184848600.review:
Por allá, en los noventa aparecieron un montón de aventuras point-and-click en su mayoría creadas por LucasArts. Ver este nombre era un sello de calidad de cada juego. Es exactamente en esta empresa donde comienza a escribirse la historia de Tim Schafer. Este tipo participó en la creación de Maniac Mansion y luego fue co-escritor y programador de The Secret of Monkey Island, Monkey Island 2: LeChuck 's Revenge y Day of the Tentacle. Era claro que Tim la tenía larga, entonces es cuando lidera dos joyas del mundo gaming: Full Throttle (1995) y Grim Fandango (1998). En el 2000 es cuando decide irse y fundar Double Fine Productions y tras cinco años de trabajo [b]Psychonauts[/b] ve la luz y Tim nos muestra que además de tenerla larga, también la usa de bufanda.

[b]Psychonauts[/b] es un juego de aventuras y plataformas publicado en 2005. Hay quienes lo supieron jugar en la PS2, Xbox y algunos en Windows XP, pero afortunadamente hoy lo podemos volver a jugar en sistemas actuales de principio a fin. El juego alardea de un diseño único y excelente apartado gráfico (para la época). Pese a todo no ha envejecido del todo mal y no daña la vista. Sus escenarios son diversos y en ocasiones hace uso inteligente de las perspectivas. Suben el listón cuando entra la banda sonora en escena. La musicalización es digna del cine y genera la ambientación adecuada para cada momento. 

El gameplay es adecuado. Puede que este sea su punto más flojo, pero no por eso imposible de jugar. Usar gamepad es más que recomendado y el personaje responde muy bien. Puede que algunas mecánicas de juego hayan envejecido un poco mal, pero no interrumpe para nada su jugabilidad. Los niveles de plataformas son interesantes aunque algunas veces pueden generar algo de frustración. La dificultad es completamente acertada y no tiene picos artificiales.

Lo verdaderamente interesante es su argumento. Sos un niño llamado Razputin que desea ser un psiconauta. Para eso te introducís en un campamento de niños en formación pero rápidamente comprendés que algo anda mal. Desde ahí comenzás a usar tus crecientes habilidades psíquicas para introducirte en la mente de las personas y resolver los distintos problemas hasta llegar al núcleo de ello. Asimismo, también vas revelando tus miedos ocultos.

[b]Psychonauts[/b] es uno de esos juegos donde una vez comenzados no se puede dejar de jugar. Es cierto que su inicio es más bien áspero, pero puede desarrollar todo su potencial pasadas las primeras horas. Tiene muchos coleccionables por lo que su duración total puede exceder cómodamente las 15 horas de juego. Es común encontrarlo en descuento aunque incluso a precio completo sigue siendo una buena compra. Muy recomendado antes de jugar su segunda parte.

Замечательная игра!
Начиная с первых уровней и их разнообразием, также замена контраста музыки. В игре кучу всего вкусного, сюжетный поворот, дизайн локаций и неплохих шуточек!
Также хочется подметить что вселенная уникальная и продуманная!
Но к сожалению также есть минусы. Первый, который заметил, это то, что в игре есть разные локации с шестами, либо арматурами и бывает персонаж не хочет за них цепляться и так несколько раз. Некоторые босс-файты интуитивно понятно и замудренно сделаны.

184396833.review:
A little rough at the start, but if you can get past the first level or two, the game really opens up. The platforming is mostly well done accompanied by some very creative puzzles and humor. The combat shines during boss fights. There is plenty to collect in a wide variety of levels.

My only major complaint is the camera refuses to cooperate, It gets stuck behind objects and it fights you to snap back behind Raz when you want to look around. Fortunately, this does not make it unplayable.

184391684.review: I can admire the creativity and the game looks and performs fantastically well for a game this old. Just pick up and play. The problem is that it's interminable at times. I was begging for some gameplay sections to end and cutscenes to finish. The second game has endless cutscenes aswell but the gameplay is enjoyable and this one just isn't for the the most part. I didn't play it for a week and had no idea what to do and how to do it when i played again.

184386083.review:
A classic masterpiece that much to my regret, I cannot recommend without reservations on PC. However, if you happen to read this and aren't that bothered by my complains, be sure to check it out because the game is undoubtedly good.

So my main gripe with it is that the game shows its age, but not for the reasons you might expect (in fact I couldn't care less about the graphics); instead, it feels outdated for four main reasons:
[olist] [*]It has compatibility issues with W10 and higher. Thankfully it can be easily solved, so to avoid constant crashes after certain dialogues, set compatibility mode to something like Vista or earlier.

[*]The controller support doesn’t work fully. It took some time to function and recognize Steam Input during the first few game sessions, and there are certain settings that can only be adjusted using a mouse.

[*]It doesn’t come with subtitles in Spanish, which isn’t a personal barrier for me but is worth noting.

[*]But my greater issue with the title is that mission design also feels outdated. Setting aside the technical aspects and delving into the gameplay, I don’t intend to dissect every single detail, but I’ll focus particularly on three: kinesthesia, pacing and difficulty scaling.
[/olist] [list]

[*]Regarding the player's movement, jumping, shooting, grabbing stuff... It doesn’t particularly work like a charm... obviously! Still worth mentioning though, because I’m not gonna lie, there are certain parts of the game where I was mad at how clunky the controls and camera can get. Same goes for certain platforming zones, where my boy Raz took forever to grab the proper pipeline. It’s aged.

[*]The pacing, being more subjective, genuinely bothers me due to the mission structure—you spend half the game in a tutorial phase, and the rest is what truly feels like the actual game, although I have personal grievances with the design of certain levels: I find it unacceptable that some main missions are gated behind a required level. The grinding isn’t overly tedious but could've been avoided by designing a more organic structure.

[*]As for difficulty, the game is fundamentally too easy in almost all of its parts, except for around the last third. Additionally, some of these later puzzles (starting as early as the infamous Milkman mission) provide very few hints on how to solve them, so I had to check a guide. Btw, the last mission is too demanding, especially considering that throughout the game you are almost never expected to be that skilled.

[/list]

As I said previously, the game is a must, so I'm editing this review and recommending it, but in order to fully enjoy the experience, you must be aware of its flaws.

184309773.review:
Just finished the game after a year of playing it on and off. Genuinely one of the most creative, genre-blending, and awe-inspiring games i've ever played. Will try and 100% in the future.

Probably the only negative I have is that the controls are kinda finicky sometimes, and well, it WAS made in 2005, so that is to be expected.

10/10, please god, play this before you die.

184293150.review: good game very much worth the money

184284233.review:
Really inconsistent controls.  This is a timing and memorization game, but the controls and camera don't work well.  For example, at the beginning of the game, it will not detect pulling up arrow heads - nothing you can do will get it to detect the key strokes.  This makes the game unplayable later in the game when it won't detect jumping.  The camera is broken, sometimes it get stuck in a death spiral over the characters head; if you're lucky you'll die, but otherwise you get to restart the game.  Saving is next to useless, it does not save progress.

The worst part about this game is the excruciatingly awful sounds effects.  Brutally repetitive.  Just turn the sound off, otherwise it is a spike in your brain.

The puzzles made this seem like it would be a fun game, but it is so unreliable at the end when the game degenerates into lazy game design, I really hated it.  Did I mention that the sound effects are awful.

Yeah.  This sucks.  Wish I hadn't bought the package.

184283946.review: One of my favorite games of all time! I've played through it countless times, 100%'d it plus all it's sequels, and still find myself quoting lines all these years later. The characters and writing are just that timeless. The platforming is a bit wonky, you can tell it's the studio's first attempt at the genre. Some objectives are a little bit unclear at times. The entirety of the meat circus is still pretty messy too, even if it was measurably worse in it's original Xbox release. There's one specific point as you're climbing up a spinning fence you need to jump then quickly use levitation to float right away or else the camera whips around causing you to fall and you have to do the whole section over. Even still; all the levels are so incredibly imaginative, the narrative is wonderful, the ending is sweet, and it's just so much fun to play. I love this game!

184275011.review: Still holds up pretty well in 2024. Creative, interesting levels with a serviceable story that doesn’t overstay its welcome. Controls and combat and are definitely dated but shouldn’t give you much difficulty. Runs great on the Steam Deck. I did use the top guide to tweak the UI and aspect ratio.

184268323.review:
Pontuação: ★★★★★ (5/5)
[h2]Resumo[/h2]
Esse jogo é criminalmente underrated, você acompanha a história de Raz, um menino que fugiu de um circo porque quer ser um psychonaut, eles são tipo agentes secretos que tem poderes mentais, então ele invade esse campo de treinamento de crianças como ele, mas eventualmente se torna evidente que há algo estranho acontecendo e ele assume a missão de investigar esse mistério. Absolutamente amo tudo sobre esse jogo, visuais, gameplay, narrativa, é tudo impecável, não pense duas vezes antes de jogar, é muito divertido e o preço cabe no bolso.

183926613.review:
A masterpiece debut from Double Fine Productions made by Tim Schafer. The writing, comedic moments, characters and gameplay is amazing, but can become frustrating later if you're aiming to achieve 100% completion in the game.

Also, having Richard Steven Horvitz (aka [spoiler] Billy and his dad from The Grim Adventures of Billy and Mandy, Zim from Invader Zim, Alpha 5 from Mighty Morphin Power Rangers, Orthopox from Destroy All Humans! and Moxxie from Helluva Boss [/spoiler]) voicing the protagonist Raz was a perfect choice.

183897515.review:
Jogo super divertido e carismático. Um dos platformers mais criativos que já vi.
Por ser o primeiro da franquia e ser lançado no xbox original e ps2, o jogo mostra sua idade em certos aspectos. A progressão, por exemplo, tem momentos suaves, mas em outros o jogo te força a farmar arrowheads (o dinheiro do jogo) para comprar itens OBRIGATÓRIOS para progredir, estendendo artificialmente o tempo de duração do jogo. Além disso, a câmera não ajuda em certas seções, tornando o platforming e o combate mais difíceis do que deveriam ser.
Alguns dos puzzles são bem questionáveis e não dão dicas do que como resolve-lo, por exemplo, o quebra-cabeça do jardim na fase The Milkman Conspiracy. Por último, o combate é bem fraquinho, não é ruim, apenas precisava ser mais elaborado na variedade de inimigos (que é baixa), quantidade de vida deles, inteligência artificial, arena de combate, e etc. (felizmente esses são aspectos que a sequência melhora). 

Enfim esses são alguns dos problemas que tive, mas não é nada que arruine a experiência ou jogo. São pequenos gargalos a serem aturados.
No geral recomendo, é bão demais.

183891466.review: This game is ssssoooooo fun, no one is telling my brain to say this, i promise. I definetly like thisd game, and am better than you at it hee heee hee ha

Two things were made very clear to me after this playthrough: one, before even clicking on that video and without even getting though the second all the way yet, I knew right away the bottom level in this list was going to be Meat Circus and the number one would be Milkman, and two, I agreed with him when he also noted how even when this game actively makes me say “this is some darn unfair game design excreted from a male cow, why am I playing this” I still love the hell out of this game when I turn it off.

183716910.review:
Jogo criativo pra caramba, dá pra ver a todo o momento como os desenvolvedores fizeram essa história com carinho, todos os diálogos são super bem feitos e divertidos. A dublagem é muito caricata e a todo o momentos te lembra um desenho do Cartoon de quando era criança.

Alguns pontos fracos são o design das fases que é confuso muitas vezes, devido a idade do jogo, e a falta de dificuldade, mas aí é mais do gênero de plataforma que sempre são bem tranquilinhos pra crionças.

No geral é um jogo muito bem humorado, que até que envelheceu bem pela idade, mais velho que eu por alguns meses inclusive, e que diverte em quase todos os momentos. Ansioso para jogar a continuação!
